organization.$: AGH University of Science and Technology

affiliation.ce:source-text: AGH University of Science and Technology, 30 Mickiewicza, 30-059, Krakow, Poland

head.citation-title: Multiple-criteria-Based Object Pose Tracking in RGB Videos
head.abstracts: © 2022, The Author(s), under exclusive license to Springer Nature Switzerland AG.In this work, a multi-criteria analysis is leveraged to improve object pose tracking in RGB videos on the basis of keypoints and object shape. A quaternion representing object pose in the previous frame and RGB image in the current frame are fed to a multi-input neural network that predicts 2D locations for a set of predefined 3D object keypoints. The shape features are utilized to exclude keypoints, which are not consistent with object shape. We demonstrate experimentally that by combining shape information with sparse object keypoints considerable gains in tracking accuracy can be achieved in least-squares-based pose refinement. Owing to multiple-criteria decision-making and harnessing such object representations, the proposed method gains significant performance improvements on the OPT benchmark and achieves promising results on challenging YCB-Video dataset.

coredata.dc:description: In this work, a multi-criteria analysis is leveraged to improve object pose tracking in RGB videos on the basis of keypoints and object shape. A quaternion representing object pose in the previous frame and RGB image in the current frame are fed to a multi-input neural network that predicts 2D locations for a set of predefined 3D object keypoints. The shape features are utilized to exclude keypoints, which are not consistent with object shape. We demonstrate experimentally that by combining shape information with sparse object keypoints considerable gains in tracking accuracy can be achieved in least-squares-based pose refinement. Owing to multiple-criteria decision-making and harnessing such object representations, the proposed method gains significant performance improvements on the OPT benchmark and achieves promising results on challenging YCB-Video dataset.
coredata.dc:title: Multiple-criteria-Based Object Pose Tracking in RGB Videos
